title: Get started
content:
OpenText Service Management is an analytics-driven service management solution. It combines four key application areas: IT Service Management (ITSM), IT Asset Management (ITAM), Extended Service Management (XSM), and Cloud Management.

  • ITSM and ITAM are available out-of-the-box. You can extend them in a codeless manner. You can find available ITSM and ITAM apps in ITOM Marketplace.
  • XSM works based on out-of-the-box content such as HR workflows. You can extend them in a codeless manner. You can find available XSM apps in ITOM Marketplace.
  • Cloud Management offers the following capabilities:
    • Design and Deploy (DND)
    • Cloud Cost Reporting
    • Image Aggregation
    • Content Management

OpenText Service Management is offered as a service (SaaS), you can also deploy it on-premises or in the cloud. Additionally, its multi-tenancy support allows you to host and manage environments for multiple customers within a single installation. For more information about the supported deployment platforms, see Install.

OpenText Service Management includes components as described in the following table.

Component Description
OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) OMT powers the deployment of container-based software suites.
Suite Administration This is a user interface for a suite administrator to manage, configure, and operate the suite.
Service Management  Service Management provides a tool for service desk and help desk management that efficiently handles change and incident management. Service Management integrates a broad range of suite capabilities, Big Data, and social collaboration to enable your workforce with connected intelligence.
Smart Analytics Smart Analytics is a Service Desk solution based on big data. Smart Analytics can help you achieve the following goals:
  • Improve the Help Desk management processes
  • Reduce the time and effort that end users and IT professionals spend on submitting requests
  • Speed up the process of problem management
  • Improve the search experience across a variety of internal and external content
Service Portal Service Portal enables IT departments to offer their services in an online shopping experience, similar to the experience today at popular online retailers. With Service Portal, end users can order, track, and manage their IT services, access knowledge articles, start chat conversations, and complete surveys.
Mobile app A native mobile app that connects your organization's people and information by providing your team access to the Service Desk applications and knowledge articles on mobile devices.
